reviews.text: Gentleman at front desk was going to recommend eating places but we already had our heart set on going to the Dakota restaurant which we would highly recommend. He thought he had some coupons he could give us, could not find them right away but later he called our room to stop by front desk for coupons which entitled us to free appetizer or dessert at the Dakota.
reviews.title: Friendly check-in

reviews.text: Had two rooms, overlooking the pool and courtyard. Would have been beautiful on nice day, but we arrived when it was raining and windy. Both rooms were clean, except in one of the bathrooms there was a piece of clothing left behind from earlier guest. Not sure how they missed it.
reviews.title: Sleep in your car before staying here.

reviews.text: Breakfast was good with waffles, fruit etc. but have to agree with another person's comment that the breakfast room was very depressing.
reviews.title: Lorn in Lenox

reviews.text: This may be one of the cheaper places to stay in the Berkshires in the summer season, but it still wasn't that cheap. And there are places that charge comparable rates (like the Best Western Black Swan down the road, where we've stayed before, but which was full this time) but give a much higher level of service and comfort.
reviews.title: Even Gives Econo Lodge a Bad Name!
Enjoyed my stay at the Econolodge
reviews.text: This place is forlorn, and in bad need of some tender loving care (as well as an influx of capital, no doubt). The staff tries hard, and generally was quite friendly, but they don;t have much to work with. The place is generally ramshackle, and not terribly clean. It does have some kind of musty/moldy odor about it. It took three tries to get us a room that was (barely) acceptable: in the first, the automatic key didn't work; in the second, the door didn't lock from the outside (!); in the third, the air conditioning didn't work well, but I managed to take off the front cover and jimmy around with a couple of vents, and got it to work ok), Housekeeping is so-so (at best), and far from thorough (lots of dust in the corners and along the edges). The teleivison, however, worked fine-- as did the ice machine.

reviews.title: Econo friendly
reviews.text: The pool looked pretty clean, and they have a rather nice (but basic) "courtyard" with lounge chairs set up, which seemed comfortable. But the hallways were dark and drear in the extreme, and the carpeting needed a real good cleaning.
The continental breakfast was ok, though it seemed a little disorganized. Due to overflow in the main room, some of us had to sit in the bar, which would have been fine had the lights been turned on.
reviews.title: It is exactly what to expect from an EconoLodge
What a dump - Don't stay here
reviews.text: The location is good, on the main road to Pittsfield, and only about 10 minutes or so from Tanglewood. On our next trip to the Berkshires, though, I'll look around some more nd try to find another place at a comparable price. Or, I'll start earlier and book a room at the Best Western Black Swan down the road.
